events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th involving another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and accident description.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the claim and coordinate further actions with the claimant.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim is now officially acknowledged by the insurer.
The claimant was asked to provide photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates for processing.
All requested documents including photos, police report, and repair quotes were submitted by the customer without delay.
A claims investigator commenced the review of the submitted evidence and contacted the other party involved in the collision.
The investigation concluded with a clear finding that the claimant was not at fault in the auto accident.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the timely offer and clarity of the settlement proposal received.
The claim was approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
The payment corresponding to the approved settlement was issued directly to the repair shop and the claimant.
The insurance claim has been closed successfully after full settlement payment and final documentation were completed.
